app_update_version.comment: Json array of the latest version info returned by the update check URL

working_version.comment: The version ID being worked on, which can be the string 'working'

core_dev.comment: IN_DEV only. Store when the database schema was last synced.

create_menu.comment: Cached contents of the "Create" drop down menu.

members_disable_pm.comment: 0 - not disabled, 1 - disabled, member can re-enable, 2 - disabled

permission_array.comment: A cache of the clubs and social groups that the member is in

completed.comment: Whether the account is completed or not

achievements_points.name: achievements_points

latest_alert.name: latest_alert
latest_alert.comment: Indicates the last alert that was viewed

g_create_clubs.name: g_create_clubs

g_club_allowed_nodes.name: g_club_allowed_nodes
g_club_allowed_nodes.comment: Node types that can be created in clubs, or * for all

g_promote_exclude.name: g_promote_exclude
g_promote_exclude.comment: Exclude members in this group from group promotions

g_club_limit.name: g_club_limit
g_club_limit.comment: Maximum number of clubs, NULL for unlimited

email_sent.name: email_sent

do_not_delete.name: do_not_delete

reg_cancelled.name: reg_cancelled

ref.name: ref
ref.comment: URL to redirect the user to after validation is complete

lang_enabled.comment: Indicates if the language is enabled
lang_enabled.name: lang_enabled

lang_id.comment: The ID number for the language
lang_id.name: lang_id

word_app.comment: The application key, if word belongs to an application
word_app.name: word_app

word_plugin.comment: The plugin ID, if word belongs to a plugin
word_plugin.name: word_plugin

word_theme.comment: The theme ID, if the language string belongs to a theme.
word_theme.name: word_theme

word_default_version.comment: The application/plugin version the word was last changed in
word_default_version.name: word_default_version

word_custom_version.comment: The application/plugin version installed when this word was customised
word_custom_version.name: word_custom_version

word_js.comment: Binary if this word should be available to JavaScript
word_js.name: word_js

word_export.comment: Binary if this word should be exported (i.e. is not a forum/etc name)
word_export.name: word_export

word_is_custom.comment: Word is custom to the site?
word_is_custom.name: word_is_custom

24.word_default:
Please take a moment to review these rules.

Please remember that we are not responsible for any messages posted. We do not vouch for or warrant the accuracy, completeness or usefulness of any message, and are not responsible for the contents of any message.

The messages express the views of the author of the message, not necessarily the views of this website. Any user who feels that a posted message is objectionable is encouraged to contact us immediately by email. We have the ability to remove objectionable messages and we will make every effort to do so, within a reasonable time frame, if we determine that removal is necessary.

You agree, through your use of this service, that you will not use this website to post any material which is knowingly false and/or defamatory, inaccurate, abusive, vulgar, hateful, harassing, obscene, profane, sexually oriented, threatening, invasive of a person's privacy, or otherwise violative of any law.

You agree not to post any copyrighted material unless the copyright is owned by you or by this website.

Our software uses cookies to distinguish you from other users of our website. This helps us to provide you with a personalized experience when you browse this site.

mail_offset.name: mail_offset
mail_offset.comment: The offset for when the next batch is sent

app.comment: The application key which owns the task.
app.name: app

frequency.comment: DateInterval specification for the frequency the task runs.
frequency.name: frequency

next_run.comment: Unix timestamp of next time task should be ran.
next_run.name: next_run

running.comment: Indicates if task is currently running (to prevent duplicate runs).
running.name: running

enabled.comment: Some tasks may set this automatically when they do/don't have things to do.
enabled.name: enabled

plugin.comment: The plugin ID number which owns the task.
plugin.name: plugin

lock_count.comment: How many times the task has been in a locked state without a successful run. A count of 3 will trigger a dashboard warning.
lock_count.name: lock_count

last_run.name: last_run

content_id.comment: The ID number of the content that was reported.

last_updated.comment: Unix timestamp of the last time a comment or report was made (for read/unread marking)

app.comment: Application key, if belongs to app

type.comment: C for code, S for skin

announce_permissions.name: announce_permissions

notification_app.comment: The application that owns this type of notification

item_class.comment: The class for the item the notification is about

item_id.comment: The ID number for the item the notification is about

leader_type.comment: Record is for member (m) or group (g)

member.comment: The ID number of the member making the edit

time.comment: Unix timestamp of the date the edit was made

public.comment: Indicates if the log should display publicly

lang_key.comment: The language key to use for the result link

restriction.comment: If applicable, the ACP restriction key that should be checked for this result

app.comment: The application which owns the widget (if applicable)

plugin.comment: The plugin which owns the widget (if applicable)

class.comment: What type of widget is this? e.g. \IPS\Widget\StaticCache

restrict.comment: JSON array of owner app restrictions (e.g. core restricts to sidebar only, content restricts to IP.Content only)

allow_reuse.comment: If 1, the widget can be re-used instead of having the block vanish from the manager's block list.

embeddable.name: embeddable

priority.comment: Order to run. Values 1 to 5 are allowed, 1 being highest priority.

index_object_id.comment: The ID of the object. pid for posts, tid for topics etc

index_item_id.comment: For comments and reviews, the ID of the item it pertains to. For \IPS\Content\Item this would just be NULL
index_item_id.name: index_item_id

index_container_id.name: index_container_id

index_permissions.comment: A comma-delimited list of groups which have permission to view
index_permissions.name: index_permissions

index_hidden.comment: 0 = visible, -1 = hidden (previously visible), 1 = unapproved, 2 = parent item hidden
index_hidden.name: index_hidden

index_item_index_id.comment: The index ID of the item

index_is_last_comment.comment: Is this the last comment/review on an item?
index_is_last_comment.name: index_is_last_comment

index_container_class.comment: The class of the container that relates to index_container_id
index_container_class.name: index_container_class

index_club_id.comment: The club ID, or NULL if it does not belong to a club
index_club_id.name: index_club_id

last_id.comment: Stores the last ID included in this sitemap
last_id.name: last_id

cache_expire.name: cache_expire
cache_expire.comment: Unix timestamp of when the cache expires

app.comment: The application key for the item
app.name: app

position.comment: This item's position within the bar
position.name: position

parent.name: parent
parent.comment: The ID of the parent item if this is on the second bar, or NULL if the first bar

permissions.name: permissions
permissions.comment: Comma-delimited list of group IDs, or * for all, NULL to inherit

is_menu_child.name: is_menu_child
is_menu_child.comment: If this item is a child of a dropdown menu

classes.comment: The classes this stream will pull from or null for all
classes.name: classes

containers.comment: A JSON-encoded array of classes to allowed containers or NULL for all
containers.name: containers

ownership.comment: Stream pulls all content or only content the viewer has started or posted in
ownership.name: ownership

read.comment: If the stream only includes unread items
read.name: read

follow.comment: If the stream only shows followed content
follow.name: follow

date_type.comment: The date range for the stream
date_type.name: date_type

date_start.comment: If using a custom date, the start date
date_start.name: date_start

date_end.comment: If using a custom date, the end date
date_end.name: date_end

member.comment: The member who created the stream or null for a global stream
member.name: member

sort.comment: Whether the stream sorts newest first or oldest first by default
sort.name: sort

date_relative_days.comment: If using a relative date period, the number of days
date_relative_days.name: date_relative_days

custom_members.comment: If using custom ownership, the member IDs
custom_members.name: custom_members

followed_types.comment: If filtering by followed content, what kind of follows to include
followed_types.name: followed_types

include_comments.comment: Should comments and reviews be included?
include_comments.name: include_comments

title.comment: If this is a member-created stream, the title (admin created streams use language strings)
title.name: title

default.comment: Default item shows to the right of the top breadcrumb navigation
default.name: default

default_view.name: default_view

classname.comment: Name of the class the view is for

id.comment: The ID number for the object
id.name: id

data.name: data

date.name: date
date.comment: Unix timestamp of when the data was retrieved

api_permissions.name: api_permissions
api_permissions.comment: JSON encoded details of which endpoints the key can access

method.name: method

api_key.name: api_key
api_key.comment: The API key that was used

ip_address.name: ip_address
ip_address.comment: The IP address that the request came from

date.name: date
date.comment: Timestamp of when request was made

is_bad_key.name: is_bad_key
is_bad_key.comment: If this log is for a request with a bad key - used to prevent brute force

client_id.name: client_id

member_id.name: member_id

access_token.name: access_token

index_id.comment: Related rows index ID from core_search_index

member.name: member
member.comment: The member ID the code was generated for

time.name: time

created.name: created
created.comment: Unix timestamp of when the club was created

cover_offset.name: cover_offset
cover_offset.comment: The position offset for the cover photo

featured.name: featured
featured.comment: Binary value indicating if club is featured

location_lat.name: location_lat

location_long.name: location_long
location_long.comment: The longitude of the club location

content.name: content

rebuilt.name: rebuilt

approved.name: approved

joined.name: joined

f_required.name: f_required
f_required.comment: Binary value indicating if the field is required

f_filterable.name: f_filterable

device_key.comment: A random string whose value will be set as a permanent cookie to identify a device
device_key.name: device_key

member_id.comment: The member ID authenticated on the device
member_id.name: member_id

user_agent.name: user_agent

login_key.name: login_key

last_seen.comment: A unix timestamp of when the device was last used. Updated at session start, not on every click
last_seen.name: last_seen

anonymous.name: anonymous

login_handler.name: login_handler

device_key.name: device_key

last_seen.name: last_seen
last_seen.comment: A unix timestamp of when the device was last used on this IP address. Updated at session start, not on every click

promote_class_id.comment: The main ID for the content item/comment
promote_class_id.name: promote_class_id

promote_text.comment: JSON array of text for all services
promote_text.name: promote_text

promote_added.comment: The date the item was authored or last edited

response_service_id.name: response_service_id

promote_actions.comment: Json-encoded array of actions taken when this rule applies

oauth_client_secret.name: oauth_client_secret
oauth_client_secret.comment: The hashed client secret or NULL for public clients

oauth_access_token_length.name: oauth_access_token_length
oauth_access_token_length.comment: Number of hours access token lives for, or NULL for no limit

oauth_use_refresh_tokens.name: oauth_use_refresh_tokens
oauth_use_refresh_tokens.comment: Boolean value indicating if refresh tokens should be used

oauth_refresh_token_length.name: oauth_refresh_token_length
oauth_refresh_token_length.comment: Number of days refresh tokens live for, or NULL for no expiry or not applicable

oauth_enabled.name: oauth_enabled
oauth_enabled.comment: Boolean value indicating if client is enabled

oauth_prompt.name: oauth_prompt
oauth_prompt.comment: How to prompt users. login = Users must always login. reauthorize = Users are shown authorize screen. automatic = Users with an existing access token skip authorise screen. none = Never show screen

oauth_choose_scopes.name: oauth_choose_scopes
oauth_choose_scopes.comment: Boolean value indicating if user can choose which of the requested scopes to grant

oauth_ucp.name: oauth_ucp
oauth_ucp.comment: Boolean value indicating if the user can see and revoke their authorization in their settings page

oauth_brute_force.name: oauth_brute_force
oauth_brute_force.comment: JSON-encoded array of IP addresses and failed authentication, for brute-force prevention

oauth_type.name: oauth_type
oauth_type.comment: A hint for how to display the form (NULL is generic custom)

oauth_graphql.name: oauth_graphql
oauth_graphql.comment: A boolean indicating if this client (and access tokens issued by it) can access the GraphQL API

member_id.comment: The member ID or NULL for client_credentials
member_id.name: member_id

access_token_expires.comment: Unix timestamp of when access token expires, or NULL for never
access_token_expires.name: access_token_expires

refresh_token.comment: Refresh token or NULL if not applicable
refresh_token.name: refresh_token

refresh_token_expires.comment: Unix timestamp of when refresh token expires or NULL if never - will be same value as access_token_expires if not applicable
refresh_token_expires.name: refresh_token_expires

scope.name: scope
scope.comment: JSON-encoded array of scopes or NULL if no scope was requested

authorization_code.name: authorization_code
authorization_code.comment: The authorization code that generated the access token, if applicable

issued.name: issued
issued.comment: Unix timestamp of when access token was generated

auth_user_agent.name: auth_user_agent
auth_user_agent.comment: The user agent that the user performed authentication on, if known

issue_user_agent.name: issue_user_agent
issue_user_agent.comment: The user agent that the access token was issued to, if known

device_key.name: device_key
device_key.comment: The device key of the device used to obtain this access token, if known

status.name: status
status.comment: The status. "active" means "active if within expiry date".

redirect_uri.comment: The redirect_uri provided in the request
redirect_uri.name: redirect_uri

scope.comment: JSON-encoded array of scopes or NULL if no scope was requested
scope.name: scope

used.comment: Boolean value indicating if code has been used
used.name: used

code_challenge.name: code_challenge
code_challenge.comment: The PKCE code challenge, if one was provided by the client

code_challenge_method.name: code_challenge_method
code_challenge_method.comment: The PKCE code challenge method, if applicable

user_agent.name: user_agent
user_agent.comment: The user agent that the user performed authentication on, if known

device_key.name: device_key
device_key.comment: The device key of the device used to obtain this authorization code, if known

login_acp.name: login_acp
login_acp.comment: Boolean value indicating if method can be used for ACP logins

login_enabled.name: login_enabled
login_enabled.comment: Boolean value indicating if method is enabled

login_register.name: login_register
login_register.comment: Boolean value indicating if users can register using this method

login_front.name: login_front
login_front.comment: Boolean value indicating if method can be used for frontend logins

token_login_method.comment: The ID number of the login method
token_login_method.name: token_login_method

token_identifier.comment: The server's identifier for the user
token_identifier.name: token_identifier

token_linked.comment: Boolean value indicating if the account has been successfully linked
token_linked.name: token_linked

token_expires.comment: Unix timestamp of when the access token expires
token_expires.name: token_expires

token_id_token.name: token_id_token
token_id_token.comment: ID token for Open ID Connect implementations

timestamp.name: timestamp
timestamp.comment: Unix timestamp of when this prompt was initially shown

logged_in.name: logged_in
logged_in.comment: Has the user logged in yet (for prompts that require it)?

code_challenge.name: code_challenge
code_challenge.comment: The PKCE code challenge, if one was provided by the client

code_challenge_method.name: code_challenge_method
code_challenge_method.comment: The PKCE code challenge method, if applicable

app.name: app
app.comment: The key of the application this notification belongs to

ext.name: ext
ext.comment: The extension this notification belongs to within the application

sent.name: sent
sent.comment: Unix timestamp of when this notification was sent

extra.name: extra
extra.comment: Any additional data about the notification

time.name: time
time.comment: Unix timestamp of when the notification was dismissed

view.comment: Does the admin want to view this type of notification?
view.name: view

email.comment: How frequently to email the admin about this notification
email.name: email

dismissible.name: dismissible
dismissible.comment: If the bulletin can be dismissed

link.name: link
link.comment: Where the notification should link to

cached.name: cached
cached.comment: Unix timestamp of when this row was cached

conditions.name: conditions
conditions.comment: PHP code to check if notification should show

class.comment: The class of the content that was posted
class.name: class

id.comment: The ID of the content that was posted
id.name: id

timestamp.comment: Unix timestamp of when the content was posted
timestamp.name: timestamp

secret.comment: A secret key which is used to link the user to this content
secret.name: secret

member.comment: The ID number of the member account once it has been created but before it has been validated
member.name: member

followup.comment: Unix timestamp of when followup email was sent
followup.name: followup

language.comment: ID number of the language that the guest had selected
language.name: language

cache_expire.comment: Unix timestamp of when the cache expires
cache_expire.name: cache_expire

rss_import_settings.comment: Json array of the extensions settings
rss_import_settings.name: rss_import_settings

rss_import_enclosures.name: rss_import_enclosures
rss_import_enclosures.comment: Enclosure handling: import, ignore or hotlink

api_key.comment: The API key which owns this webhook
api_key.name: api_key

events.comment: Comma-delimited list of events to fire for
events.name: events

url.comment: The URL to send webhook to
url.name: url

filters.name: filters
filters.comment: JSON-encoded array of filters for each event

time.name: time
time.comment: Unix timestamp of when it was requested

fails.name: fails
fails.comment: The number of times we have tried (and failed) to send

s3_marker.name: s3_marker
s3_marker.comment: Last key seen, so it can be used to get the next result set from AWS

member.name: member
member.comment: Member ID. This is not a unique reference, since PWA notifications are per device, not per user.

endpoint.name: endpoint
endpoint.comment: Endpoint URL. Use TEXT as endpoints may exceed the limits of VARCHAR.

encoding.name: encoding
encoding.comment: The content encoding preferred by this browser

member.comment: The member whose points were changed
member.name: member

datetime.comment: A unix timestamp of when this occurred
datetime.name: datetime

balance.comment: The member's new points balance after this change
balance.name: balance

rules.comment: A comma-delimited list of rules which were applied
rules.name: rules

action_log.name: action_log
action_log.comment: The ID number of the log in core_achievements_log which indicates the action that was performed

actor.name: actor
actor.comment: If the member receiving the points was the subject or other in the action

new_rank.name: new_rank
new_rank.comment: If earnings these points changed the rank, the new rank ID

time_to_new_rank.name: time_to_new_rank
time_to_new_rank.comment: Time in seconds member took to receive this rank

datetime.name: datetime
datetime.comment: Unix timestamp of when the member earned this badge

rule.name: rule
rule.comment: A ID number of the rule which triggered earning the badge

action_log.name: action_log
action_log.comment: The ID number of the log in core_achievements_log which indicates the action that was performed

actor.name: actor
actor.comment: If the member receiving the badge was the subject or other in the action

manually_awarded.name: manually_awarded
manually_awarded.comment: Can this badge be manually awarded?

action.name: action
action.comment: The action that this rule applies to

milestone.name: milestone
milestone.comment: If applicable, the particular milestone this is for

points_subject.name: points_subject
points_subject.comment: The points to award to the main person (can be negative)

badge_subject.name: badge_subject
badge_subject.comment: The badge ID to award to the main person

points_other.name: points_other
points_other.comment: The points to award to any other relevant people (can be negative)

badge_other.name: badge_other
badge_other.comment: The badge ID to award to any other relevant people

identifier.name: identifier
identifier.comment: An identifier for the thing the action is being performed on (e.g. if this is for making a post, the post ID)

datetime.name: datetime
datetime.comment: A unix timestamp of when this occurred

alert_viewed.name: alert_viewed
alert_viewed.comment: The number of times this alert has been viewed
